result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Lamarcus McKinney

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin Lamarcus McKinney in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Justin Lamarcus McKinney.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for February 8, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Justin Lamarcus McKinney in court.  Attorney Corey Flynn on behalf of Michael V Fuentes in court for Justin Lamarcus McKinney.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Calendar Call held.  Court vacates any previously stayed bench warrant.  Defense counsel advises Court he still needs off and discovery and requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Justin Lamarcus McKinney not in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Justin Lamarcus McKinney.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter available. Case scheduled for pretrial conference. Defendant failing to appear. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.
Calendar call scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 08-27-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AB, MB. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 15.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin Lamarcus McKinney
Current: 2017 North 33rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 08-05-2022)
Prior: 2017 North 33rd Street #3, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/25/22 @ 1:30p
